data.title: One week in: The transformation of Cheryl Fernandez-Versini
data.meta_description: WHAT a week it has been for the girl who grew up in Newcastle as Cheryl Tweedy.
data.text:
She has acquired an exotic double-barrelled surname, being newly married to Frenchman Jean-Bernard Fernandez-Versini after a whirlwind romance

And friends say she has never been happier – or looked better.

On Monday Cheryl was at a party in London on her husband’s arm to celebrate their wedding with around 80 of her family and friends, wearing a sheer black dress by British couturiers Ralph & Russo.

On Wednesday, she launched her new perfume, Storm Flower, in a soft-gold lace couture gown with a thigh-high split by Zuhair Murad.

And on Thursday the Geordie songstress attended the BBC Radio 1 studios in London, looking gorgeous in a butter-soft pleated leather skirt while getting ready to celebrate her latest single set to hit No 1.

The X Factor judge, 31, married Jean-Bernard, 33, in secret earlier this month on the Caribbean island of Mustique.

Insiders say the look of love is adding a little extra “je ne sais quoi” to the new Mrs Fernandez-Versini’s radiant glow – with the singer saying of married life this week: “Yes, I’m enjoying it very much.”

I can’t remember being so excited to be releasing new music

Cheryl Fernandez-Versini

Invalid email

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

While her personal life could not be better, her professional life is also on a high with her new single Crazy Stupid Love tipped to top the charts and a new seat on the X Factor judging panel after signing a reported £1.5million contract with the show’s mastermind Simon Cowell.

A spokesperson for the Official Charts Company said Crazy Stupid Love is leading the race to the top spot to give Cheryl her fourth solo chart topper.

The up-tempo track, which also features Tinie Tempah, is Cheryl’s last release under her former married name, Cheryl Cole.

The single is out in front of all other contenders by a sizeable margin – 22,000 chart sales. “I can’t remember being so excited to be releasing new music,” said Cheryl. “After taking some time out I feel brand new.”

It looks like Cheryl has truly forgotten all the heartache of her marriage to former Chelsea player Ashley Cole.
